Description: Fragment from the body of a shallow dish: both surfaces matt. A conglomerate of very small pieces of opaque glass arranged in two layers in an open mould and fused together by firing. The pieces used are turquoise-blue, brick-red, yellow, white, and brown. Both surfaces have been pumiced to a remarkable smoothness.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: A fragment of the finest quality and of a technique found only in royal work.
Bibliographic references: Tait 1991 / Five Thousand Years of Glass (fig.32, p.33)
